edu.du.penrose.systems.fedoraApp
Class ProgramFileProperties

java.lang.Object
  edu.du.penrose.systems.fedoraApp.ProgramProperties
      edu.du.penrose.systems.fedoraApp.ProgramFileProperties

public class ProgramFileProperties
extends ProgramProperties

Manages property files used by the application using a java.util.Properties object.

This class does not throw exceptions if unable to access the underlying file system but rather simply returns null for a property on any error.

Author:
chet.rebman

public java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key)
Description copied from class: ProgramProperties
Get the property from the underlying storage medium. If the storage medium or the field/value does not exist null is returned. If the key is null, an exception is thrown.

getPropertyNamesAsOrderedArray

public java.lang.String[] getPropertyNamesAsOrderedArray()
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from class: ProgramProperties
This uses the properties values to set the order for the property names.
We assume the each property has a number as its value. This number is used to order the results.
No assumptions are made a correct properties file is assumed.

Specified by:
getPropertyNamesAsOrderedArray in class ProgramProperties
Returns:
array of ordered property names.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on any error.
See Also:
ProgramProperties.getPropertyNamesAsOrderedArray()
